acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 48-hour EC50=20.8mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 from rat LD50: 382mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 4 from the statement of rat inhalation LC50: 4000ppm (4h) (RTECS (2005)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 3 based on SPECIES: Rat;  ENDPOINT: LD50;: 111mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: Priority 1,2

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Category 2 because of "possible to cause chemical pneumonia by misswallowing of the liquid."(ICSC(J), 1999)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data and reports

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 70-80%(IUCLID, 2000)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.26 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: -37degC, Initial Boiling point (Boiling point): 32degC

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Each in vitro mutagenicity test (Ames examination, chromosomal aberration test) result was negative, however, we found no in vivo test data and we presupposed that we could not categorize it by the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen and halogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The substance with ignition points of 400 degC (Hommmel (1991)) does not ignite in room temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It is reported maternal toxicity was NOAEL 0.05mg/L and teratogenicity NOAEL 1mg/L (maximum administration dose) (IUCLID (2000) priority 2). However, it was presupposed that it cannot classify for classifying because of insufficient data.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Since there is no data, it cannot be classified.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although the eye irritation recovers in 3 - 4 hours in human exposure to vapor, blurred vision remains in exposures of fluids (PATTY (2001)). It was set as Cayegory 1 from the description of grade 10 (PATTY (5th, 2001)) in the eye stimulativeness examination of the rabbit.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In rabbit skin irritation test, it was assigned grade6 (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and there is a description that it irritates skin and may cause burn on human skin (HSDB (2005)), it was classified as Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on a statement that the result of an animal test was negative(IUCLID (2000)),  it was  put outside of the Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (eye, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although it was priority2, based on the statement that repeated exposure causes vision loss, stimulus of lungs, and bronchitis, it was classified to as Category 2 (SITTIG (47th, 2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Irritation of the nose and throat was identified by short term exposures of 10 - 20ppm with Volunteers (ACGIH (2001)), and  there are descriptions that pulmonary edemas are caused at high exposure levels resulting in death in cace the treatment is delayed (ACGIH (2001); SITTIG (47th, 2002)). So it was set as Category 1(respiratory systems).
